Detailed Description

Implementation of a TCP server.

This class implements a TCP server able to receive connections from clients instantiated with class TCPClient. A typical usage for this class is: 

  TCPServer *server = TCPServer::create(4567, 1);
  if (server == NULL) error();
  TCPClient *client = server->accept();
  if (client == NULL) error();
  // connection is established.
  
  while (communicating) {
      // receive request from client :
      DataB request;
      int length = sizeof(request);
      client->receive((void*)&request, length);
      // here <request> contains <length> bytes of received data.
  
      // send answer to client :
      DataA answer = ... ;    // process request to create answer
      client->send((void*)&answer, sizeof(answer));
      }
  server->close();

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

~TCPServer (   ) 
 

Destroys the object.

The close() method needs to be called before.

Member Function Documentation

TCPClient * accept (   ) 
 

Waits for connection with a client.

Returns:
the first connecting client of NULL if some error occured.

bool close (   ) 
 

Closes the server.

Must be called before destroying this object.

Returns:
true on success, false if some error occured.

TCPServer * create (  int  port = 6666,
int  maxConnections = 1
)  [static]
 

Creates a TCP server receiving connections on the specified port.

Parameters:
port the port receiving connections to this server.
maxConnections the maximum number of connections on this server.
Returns:
the newly created server or NULL if some error occured.
